Legal_Issue: Whether the Canadian Human Rights Commission committed a reviewable error in dismissing the complaint
Evidence_Assessment: Witness testimonies and medical evidence did not support the claims
Burden_of_Proof: On the Applicant to demonstrate merit in the complaint
Credibility_Factor: Claims lacked evidentiary and testimonial support
Legal_Rule: The Commission must conduct a fair, thorough, and neutral investigation; may dismiss under CHRA s. 44(3)(b) if no merit is found
Procedural_Issue: Procedural fairness in the investigation and dismissal process
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged harassment and discrimination based on age, ethnicity, and disability
Outcome_on_Merits: No merit found in the complaint
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Commission allowed Applicant to respond to investigator’s report before dismissal
Key_Evidence_Considered: Witness testimonies, medical evidence, investigator’s report
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to the Commission's dismissal of the complaint
Court_Result: No basis for intervention; Commission acted reasonably
Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated, but investigation did not substantiate claims
Outcome: Complaint dismissed; judicial review application denied
Resolution_Mechanism: Administrative investigation followed by judicial review
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of supporting evidence for harassment and discrimination claims
Applicable_Process: Complaint investigation under CHRA, followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: CHRA s. 44(3)(b); principles of procedural fairness
